content: Reminder that we have a call today from 3-5 Eastern. https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/696476549

I'd like to put on today's agenda a vote for approving https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/Bulk+Data+Publication+Request, assuming @Ricky Sahu confirms that the outstanding errors/earnings have been addressed (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/bulk-data/qa.html#internal)

@FHIR-I Co-chairs

Note that the majority appear spurious, with many repeats of

  • The link 'http://hl7.org/fhir/' for "FHIR 4.0.0" cannot be resolved
  • The link 'http://hl7.org/fhir-issues' for "Propose a change" cannot be resolved

(Both of which I think should be valid)
I only have the 330-4 block available and will join the meeting at that time today
Can you clarify whether you'll be able to fix the build errors beforehand?
fixes for all build errors r in, josh will merge after a review
Merged, thanks @Ricky Sahu! New QA at http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/bulk-data/qa.html shows only one error, which looks like a bug in the build tool rather than the spec (FYI @Grahame Grieve)
yes. well be fixed next release
I'm joining the call, but I don't know if bandwidth will be good enough. (I am in Australia, after all)
... the meeting will begin when Lloyd joins ....

Block vote

Brian Reinhold

Line Items
GF#21028 Insufficient+documentation+on+sorted+search (Brian Reinhold) Not Persuasive
GF#22844 Element+name+%22Meta%22+instead+of+meta (Lin Zhang) Not Persuasive

GF#20822 IG+publisher+documentation+points+to+outdated+Ruby%2FJekyll+install+page (David deRoode) Persuasive

GF#20842 Dependent+variables+should+be+of+type+%22id%22 (Ewout Kramer) Persuasive

Woud like to take up J#25208 if possible --and perhaps dip into bundle type discussion for subscriptions (given devdays conversations).
I'm likely to be late for today's call (meeting running over)
doh. The registry call is next week
I was just trying to figure out where this was. Thanks for commenting here!
@Mark Kramer those jurisdiction validation errors will be fixed next time I upgrade tx.fhir.org
I sent an email to hl7 asking I could not join the meeting. :sweat:
Sorry, I signed off accidentally just now -- but good call today everyone, and see you next time!
Quick heads up that I am taking the day off and will miss today's call.
Could I add a discussion about the Subscription Backport IG to today's agenda please? Thanks!
I would like to add a proposed patient list PSS to the agenda as well. For co-sponsorship consideration.
I will add both to today's agenda.
Thanks Yunwei!
what's the meeting link for fhir-I? The one on confluence doesn't seem to be right

this is what I have:
https://hl7-org.zoom.us/j/8583747934?pwd=VnZiWFZsNm1TSk5QWmZlbVJyQVZGdz09
The link I have, https://hl7-org.zoom.us/j/8583747934?pwd=VnZiWFZsNm1TSk5QWmZlbVJyQVZGdz09 also shows meeting not started...
ah, never mind - it's started now
Looks open now, Rick said it'll be getting started in a couple of minutes

Per discussion, current view of Backport is available here: https://ginocanessa.github.io/Backport-IG-View/ .
I am currently working on the Conformance section (creating CapabilityStatements and adding documentation), as well as filling out the Workflow section. Thanks!

I'm working through ballot comments for the SMART Web Messaging IG. For next week's call I'd like to add this issue to the agenda:
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-29335
FYI: @Bas van den Heuvel
@Yunwei Wang - Note that @Camila Altman would like to discuss FHIR#29701
Sure, which next weeks call are you referring to? The one on Monday?
monday dec 7th 3 est :)

Gino Canessa said:

Per discussion, current view of Backport is available here: <removed> .
I am currently working on the Conformance section (creating CapabilityStatements and adding documentation), as well as filling out the Workflow section. Thanks!

Note, builds are working again! Current version is at: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-subscription-backport-ig/ . I'm removing the temp repo to avoid confusion. Thanks!

Following up from yesterday's call - I've put together a sign-up form for future SMART Web Messaging ballot triage calls. Please sign up in you're interested in attending so I can pick a good time to meet.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/179EGYzc3PBfYMPDJarF2078rIlGbX7S8VuzN4WaRINE/edit?usp=sharing
Err, I meant to send a link to fill out the form, not edit it. Ignore the link above - this is the one you want: https://forms.gle/g2kWwjBCR1sbfmjdA

I meant to post this here Monday after mentioning it in the meeting, but I forgot. There will be a meeting Friday from 10:00 AM CST - 12:30 to discuss some of the SMART Web Messaging ballot comments raised by @Matt Varghese at Epic. @Josh Mandel will be present, and anyone else is welcome to participate.
@Carl Anderson are we limiting the agenda to just items that Matt raised, or will we tackle other ballot items too?
We'll start out with Matt's issues, and then proceed if we have time and interest to keep going.
This will be the first of such meetings, so I'm not 100% sure what to expect yet.
I can't seem to access the jira filter linked in the email, what are these issues?
image.png @Paul Church - I'm assuming you're a trusted hl7 user. :-)
Anyway, these are issues raised by the Sep-2020 ballot comments for the SMART Web Messaging IG
Also to be clear, the email describes a "triage call", but the goal is actually to discuss/resolve issues, right? Not just to triage them?
Re: viewers, is it possible to just set these for public view, or whatever we use for the FHIR-I conference call filter?
image.png
I'm not in that group, just the default jira groups. How does one become a trusted HL7 user?

Yes, @Josh Mandel although I didn't know that triage calls had a different meaning. Aside: would triage be to determine the priority / severity of a collection of issues?

@Paul Church - I see that my visibility options are hl7-trusted-users, jira-core-users, and jira-software-users. I'm not sure which of the two others is more appropriate. @Lloyd McKenzie ?
You want "anyone on the web".
(It's a choice in the drop-down that says "Group" in your screenshot.)
@Paul Church - sorry for the hold-up, I've opened the filter to anyone on the "web".
Thanks, got it.

Just for extra visibility - I've sent an email invitation for tomorrow's SMART Web Messaging special session (10:00 AM Central - 11:30), but I thought I would mention it here, too. The call has also made it to HL7's concall page, here: http://hl7.org/concalls/CallDetails.aspx?concall=52799

Hope to see you all there!
@FHIR-I Co-chairs apologies, I won't be able to make today's call.
As I mentioned last week: would love to use hour 2 (i.e., 4-5p ET) of toady's FHIR-I call to continue through SMART on FHIR Ballot issues.
I will not be able to attend the 2nd hour call today.

I was hoping to address these two issues on today's call:

  • https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-31519 - adding scratchpad.read to SMART Web Messaging
  • https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-29354 - resolution conflists with FHIR-29335
sure
Re: FHIR-31519 -- this has already been voted on (3/12/2021). Is there something new to vote on, or just an update to share with the group about how this landed?
Sorry to disappear there towards the end; I had to take an unexpected call.
Due to the conflicts of meeting schedule. @FHIR-I Co-chairs decided to cancel today's weekly conference call. Sorry for the late notification.
Happy Monday! Could I please add FHIR-34314 to today's agenda? Thanks!

I would like FHIR-I or MnM guidance on https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-33170 -- sub elements are marked with _summary, but the parent element is not marked _summary. Either this is proper, or not? If not, then should the tooling (FHIR core build) throw warnings?
Hi @John Moehrke -- looks like we missed this request on today's meeting. Yunwei Wang will you track this for next week's agenda?
We did take it up - second one we covered. John expressed he was happy because the tooling was going to do his work for him :)
Never mind me :smile:
You excelled... not only solved it, but automated the problem off my, and others, hands
Now, do the same for MS! I have less hope for that one.

I think the HL7 calendar may have gotten the calls today mixed up, as it shows the Workflow call as happening, and the FHIR-I call as cancelled. Is it supposed to be the inverse, or are both calls cancelled?
Workflow is supposed to be cancelled. I forget what was decided for FHIR-I.
